image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: US aircraft carrier arrives in South Korea for military drills
Houthis target ship as Eisenhower leaves
Yemen's Houthis conduct joint military operation targeting ships in Israel
item.description: Yemen's Houthi rebels, in coordination with the Islamic Resistance in Iraq, conducted a military operation targeting ships at Israel's Haifa port using drones. The attacks aimed to disrupt shipping in solidarity with Palestinians in the Gaza conflict. The Iranian-aligned Houthis have been involved in ongoing drone and missile strikes in shipping lanes, resulting in casualties and tensions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 39 killed in Israeli strikes across North Gaza
Eight from ship that crashed into Baltimore bridge leave for India
Three killed as Russia targets power facilities
Outrage as UK politician says West provoked Ukraine war
'Idiot actually touched lion': Indian woman shares ordeal in Kenya safari in viral post
item.description: A social media post by an Indian woman chronicling the uncouth behavior of Indian tourists outside has gone viral as she posted video of a man trying to touch the lion during a safari in Kenya. Owing to the irresponsible behavior of some Indian tourists, the rest of the Indians had to hear "this one is from your country", Meenakshi Sharan wrote in her long X post urging social media users to shame the offenders.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tajikistan bans hijab in campaign against public religiosity: All you need to know
item.description: ​Tajikistan parliament has approved the law banning hijab referred to as 'alien garments' ahead of Eid al-Fitr and Eid Al-Adha imposing penalties for offenders. The move comes as part of the government's continuous efforts to curb public display of religion and to promote Tajiki culture. It also banned Idi, the custom in which children seek gift and money during Eid. The Muslim-majority country is dominated by various sects of Islam -- Sunni Muslim population in majority.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Taylor Swift's epic selfie with Prince William has a hidden message
item.description: ​Taylor has been dating Travis Kelce for almost a year now but the duo made their relationship Instagram official as Saturday with Taylor posting a selfie with Prince William in London. Fans are claiming that this was the most epic way to debut on Instagram -- with Prince William, Prince George and Princess Charlotte. It was a backstage moment during Taylor's maiden London Eras Tour show at Wembley Stadium.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Barron Trump and DJT meme coin: What is the new controversy?
item.description: Infamous Martin Shkreli recently claimed Donald Trump's youngest son Barron Trump approached him through a friend for creating the DJT meme coin. But Martin Shkreli could not provide any evidence of Barron Trump's involvement in the project. Crypto sleuth ZachXBT unveiled that Shkreli had created the token as part of an alleged pump-and-dump scheme.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is viral 'hawk tuah' girl? 5 things about this Internet sensation
item.description: 'Hawk tuah' has taken over the Internet as social media users are having a hard time to get over the viral 'hawk tuah' girl. The vigorous act of spitting in reply to an otherwise erotic question left the Internet stunned and now 'hawk tuah' merchandise are also available. The girl was asked "What's one move in bed that makes a man go crazy every time?" "Oh you have got to give it that 'hawk tuah' and spit on that thang, you get me?" she said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: How Apple's Tim Cook responded to Donald Trump's Green Card proposal
item.description: Apple's Tim Cook was one of the titans present at a business roundtable meeting where Donald Trump talked about finding ways to keep US-educated talent at home. The tech and business leaders supported Trump's idea and days after the roundtable, Trump, in a podcast, said that he would give automatic Green Cards to foreign students graduating in US, if elected to power.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Prince William 'shakes it off' at Taylor Swift concert. A selfie follows
item.description: It was Taylor Swift's first concert in London and Prince William's 42nd birthday. Both the occasions merged as William decided to celebrate his birthday witnessing Swift's magic from a private box at Wembley Stadium where he took Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Vomiting face emoji': 3 deans at Columbia University placed on leave for belittling campus Jews' worries
item.description: Three deans of Columbia University were passing snide remarks on a group chat when a panel discussion on Jewish campus life was going on. They said the remarks of the panelists; were difficult to listen to and one of the deans posted vomiting face emoji. Their chats were photographed by an alum sitting behind one of the deans.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pak minister condemns Swat lynching, says religion being weaponised to justify 'street justice'
Meet Wild Thang: Winner of world's ugliest dog contest
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 6 members of family found dead in landslide in China, severe weather warning extended
item.description: Severe downpours in China's Fujian province triggered deadly landslides, claiming the lives of six family members who sought refuge in a temple. Nearby, Guangdong province reports a death toll of 47 from the relentless rainfall, causing widespread destruction. The national meteorological center issued warnings for more severe weather, spanning southern and northern regions, with forecasts predicting hail and intense thunderstorms in multiple provinces.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Night watchman found dead in Paris hotel after robbery bid
item.description: In Paris, a night watchman is found murdered in a hotel room after a failed heist targeting a safe filled with the establishment's monthly earnings. The assailants, masked and armed, abandoned the safe and fled, leaving the watchman bound and beaten. Authorities are investigating the crime, probing motives of theft and homicide amid a complex chain of events.

item.title: Rocket carrying French-Chinese satellite launches from southwestern China to study gamma-ray bursts
item.description: A Long March 2-C rocket launched the French-Chinese SVOM satellite to study gamma-ray bursts, cosmic events from star explosions or mergers, aiming to provide valuable data on the universe's evolution.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
